question_details.title: Will Amazon still list a 12-pack of Coca-Cola as "SNAP EBT eligible" on April 1, 2025?
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if a 12-page of Coca-Cola at [this link](https://www.amazon.com/Coca-Cola-Soda-Soft-Drink-Pack/dp/B000T9WLTK?ref_=ast_sto_dp&th=1), when accessed by Metaculus from the United States on or after April 1, 2025, is listed using the exact phrase "SNAP EBT eligible"(forecasters please note that it *is* listed as such on February 19, 2025). If it is *not* listed as SNAP EBT eligible when checked by Metataculus on or after April 1, 2025, this resolves as **No**.
question_details.fine_print: The link in the resolution criteria is provided for convenience, but if Amazon's primary listing for a 12-pack of canned Coca-Cola appears elsewhere, then that will be used for resolution. In order to streamline resolution, synonyms or rephrasings will not count; the phrase must specifically be "SNAP EBT eligible".

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Coca-Cola Introduces New Bottle Size in Germany**
Coca-Cola is introducing a new bottle size, 0.85 liters, for their popular brands Cola, Fanta, Sprite, and Mezzo Mix, starting in April. According to Arne Koslowski, a Coca-Cola manager, the new size aims to fill the gap between the half-liter and family-sized bottles, targeting smaller households and singles. This move will bring the total number of packaging variants offered by Coca-Cola in Germany to 318. The iconic taste of the drinks will remain unchanged.
Original language: de
Publish date: March 06, 2025 02:46 PM
Source:[TAG24](https://www.tag24.de/nachrichten/politik/deutschland/gesellschaft/schon-ab-april-coca-cola-plant-seltene-neuerung-3365781)

**Coca-Cola Introduces New 0.85-Liter PET Bottle**
Coca-Cola is expanding its product line by introducing a new 0.85-liter PET bottle in April. According to the company, this new size is designed to target consumers in smaller households and fills a gap in their product range. The number of single and small households has been increasing for years, and the trend towards smaller packaging sizes for refreshing drinks is also continuing. Arne Koslowski, Vice President Commercial Development at Coca-Cola Europacific Partners Deutschland (CCEP DE), explains, 'We see a trend towards smaller packaging sizes for carbonated refreshing drinks.' The new packaging is the first addition to the large PET disposable bottles over 0.5 liters in 17 years. The 0.85-liter bottle will be available for the brands Coca-Cola, Coca-Cola Zero Sugar, Fanta, Sprite, and Mezzo Mix. The new bottle will be filled at the company's production sites in Dorsten/North Rhine-Westphalia, Genshagen/Brandenburg, and Knetzgau/Bavaria. According to Coca-Cola, the unbinding recommended price for the new 0.85-liter bottle will be significantly lower than that of the 1-liter disposable bottle.
Original language: de
Publish date: March 06, 2025 12:19 PM
Source:[SOL.DE - Saarland Online](https://www.sol.de/deutschland-und-welt/neue-flaschengroesse-coca-cola-ueberrascht-mit-ungewoehnlichem-format,577031.html)

**Coca-Cola Introduces New 0.85-Liter Flasche in Germany**
Coca-Cola will introduce a new 0.85-liter Pet-flasche in Germany, available starting in April. The new size will include Coca-Cola, Coca-Cola Zero Sugar, Fanta, Sprite, and Mezzo Mix. According to the company, this is the first new Pet-Einwegpfandflasche with more than 0.5 liters of content in 17 years. The company claims that this is not related to 'shrinkflation', a term used to describe the practice of reducing the size of products while keeping the price the same.
Original language: de
Publish date: March 06, 2025 10:11 AM
Source:[stern.de](https://www.stern.de/wirtschaft/news/coca-cola-fuehrt-schraege-neue-flaschengroesse-in-deutschland-ein-35527138.html)

**More economic blackouts planned: Next boycotts to target Amazon, Nestle and Target**
The People's Union, a group led by John Schwarz, also known as 'TheOneCalledJai' on Instagram, is planning more economic boycotts targeting Amazon, Nestle, Target, Walmart, McDonald's, and General Mills. The group's goal is to 'remind them who has the power,' as Schwarz said. The boycotts include a 'Amazon Blackout' from March 7 to 14, which includes avoiding Amazon-owned entities such as Whole Foods Market and Twitch. Additionally, civil rights activists in Minnesota are boycotting Target due to its decision to phase out DEI initiatives, and the Latino Freeze Movement is urging the Latino community to be 'selective' in where they shop and support businesses that align with their values. The movement has named over a dozen companies to avoid, including Coca-Cola and Amazon.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 06, 2025 09:56 AM
Source:[Yahoo](https://www.yahoo.com/news/more-economic-blackouts-planned-next-095637121.html)

**I Tried the Spindrift Soda, and It's Not What I Was Expecting**
The author, a huge fan of soda, was disappointed with Spindrift's new line of soda, which features real fruit and no added sugar. The author tried all five flavors, including Strawberry Shortcake, Concord Freeze, Orange Cream Float, Shirley Temple, and Ginger Ale, but found them to be unimpressive and lacking in flavor. The author notes that the 'sodas' have a tangy, kombucha-like taste and are not what most people think of as soda. The author recommends choosing Spindrift sparkling water instead, which has a similar flavor profile but without the disappointment. The Spindrift soda line is currently only available on the Spindrift website, Amazon, and select retailers, with a 12-pack of one single flavor costing $26.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 06, 2025 12:08 AM
Source:[Taste of Home](https://www.tasteofhome.com/article/spindrift-soda-review/)

**Coca-Cola Introduces New 0.85-Liter Bottle Size**
Coca-Cola will introduce a new 0.85-liter bottle size for its popular brands, including Coca-Cola, Coca-Cola Zero, Fanta, Sprite, and Mezzo Mix, starting in April. This move aims to fill the gap between half-liter and family-sized bottles. According to Arne Koslowski, sales manager, 'We see a trend towards smaller packaging sizes for carbonated beverages.' The company is responding to changing drinking habits, where smaller households may not finish a large bottle of soda quickly, leading to a loss of fizz and flavor. As of now, Coca-Cola offers 318 different packaging options in Germany, including PET single-use and multi-use, glass bottles, and cans. The new bottle size will be produced at the company's facilities in Dorsten, Genshagen, and Knetzgau, where machines and equipment have been upgraded to accommodate the new size. Coca-Cola invested 1.5 million euros in this upgrade.
Original language: de
Publish date: March 05, 2025 07:06 PM
Source:[Bild](https://www.bild.de/leben-wissen/verbrauchertipps/neue-flaschengroesse-bei-coca-cola-ab-april-67c880caf0c49c5db2140930)

**Amazon Sellers Should Check the Status of Their 3P Service Providers**
Amazon is requiring third-party service providers to register on the Solution Provider Portal (SPP) by the end of August. If they haven't registered by April 10, 2025, their access to Seller Central accounts will be suspended. According to Amazon documentation, sellers must list third-party providers as 'authorized partners' by April 10, 2025, to avoid losing access to their accounts. Some service providers are warning sellers to ensure their providers are compliant, as failure to do so may result in a 'nightmare' on April 10. Freelancers may also be impacted by this change.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 05, 2025 04:33 PM
Source:[EcommerceBytes](https://www.ecommercebytes.com/2025/03/05/amazon-sellers-should-check-the-status-of-their-3p-service-providers/)

**Cheetos Mac 'N Cheese Cups 12-Pack for $9 Shipped at Amazon**
Amazon is offering a 12-pack of Cheetos Mac 'N Cheese Cups in three-flavor variety for $9.81, a $1.74 discount from the regular price of $11.55. By opting for Subscribe & Save, customers can get free shipping and a price drop to $9.32. This works out to 78¢ per cup. Note that Subscribe & Save is a recurring subscription that can be cancelled at any time, and non-Prime customers will pay shipping costs for the first delivery only.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 05, 2025 04:32 PM
Source:[Free Stuff Finder](https://www.freestufffinder.com/cheetos-mac-n-cheese-cups-12-pack-for-9-shipped-at-amazon/)

**Coca-Cola Introduces New 0.85-Liter Bottle Size**
Coca-Cola is introducing a new bottle size of 0.85 liters, which will be filled at their facility in Dorsten. According to Arne Koslowski, a Coca-Cola manager, the new size is aimed at singles and smaller households who may not need a full liter. The new size will be available for purchase in April 2025, and will be offered for other Coca-Cola brands such as Fanta, Sprite, and Mezzo Mix. The new size will not replace the 1-liter bottle, and will not be sold at the same price. The investment in the new production line is estimated to be around 1.5 million euros.
Original language: de
Publish date: March 05, 2025 04:03 PM
Source:[RN](https://www.ruhrnachrichten.de/dorsten/coca-cola-dorsten-abfuellung-kuriose-flaschengroesse-neues-produkt-w1005329-2001581791/)

**Cherry Coke Mini-can, 10 pack Only $3.89 - $4.49 + Free Shipping With Subscribe & Save From Amazon - Kollel Budget**
Amazon is offering a discount on Cherry Coke Mini-cans and Sprite Zero Sugar Lemon Lime Diet Soda Pop Soft Drinks. The Cherry Coke 10-pack is marked down to $5.98, but with 'Subscribe & Save' and a coupon, it can be purchased for as low as $3.89 with free shipping. Similarly, the Sprite Zero Sugar 10-pack can be purchased for $3.89 with free shipping after applying the same discounts. Note that prices may vary and it's best to check the current price on Amazon before making a purchase.

Publish date: March 05, 2025 02:59 PM
Source:[kollelbudget.com](https://kollelbudget.com/307159-2/)

**Amazon Smilesale: 90 Essential Items on Sale**
Amazon's Smilesale event has started from February 28th and will run until March 4th. During this period, various products are on sale, including food, mineral water, drinks, and detergents. Some of the products on sale include Coca-Cola 500ml PET 24-pack (31% off), Nissin Cup Noodles (30% off), Irisoyma Mini Wett Tissues (64% off), and more. Additionally, some health and beauty products are also on sale, such as Manuka Honey MGO400+ (29% off) and Evian Mineral Water (26% off). The sale event is a great opportunity to stock up on essential items and save money. 
Original language: ja
Publish date: March 02, 2025 03:18 AM
Source:[ロケットニュース24](https://rocketnews24.com/2025/03/02/2424934/)

**Coca-Cola launching new soda with five different flavors to compete with Poppi**
The Coca-Cola Company is launching a new soda, Simply Pop, with five different flavors to compete with healthy drinks like Poppi and Olipop. The new soda will be available in select retailers and Amazon Fresh starting at the end of February, and will include six grams of fiber, Vitamin C, and Zinc. According to Becca Kerr, CEO of Nutrition at The Coca-Cola Company, the company is targeting Gen Z and Millennial customers who are interested in holistic health and wellness. Kerr said, 'We found that consumers, especially wellness-focused Gen Z-ers and Millenials, were really interested in juice and prebiotic sodas... And since many brands in this category are new, they were looking to align with names they know and trust for both quality and taste.' The new soda will be priced at $2.49 per can in some areas, with customers already expressing concerns about the cost.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 26, 2025 08:05 PM
Source:[The US Sun](https://www.the-sun.com/money/13634882/coca-cola-launches-simply-pop-price-concerns/)

**What is Simply Pop? Coca-Cola enters the prebiotic soda market**
Coca-Cola is entering the prebiotic soda market with its new line of soda alternatives, Simply Pop. According to The Coca-Cola Company, Simply Pop will come in five flavors and will be available in some markets by the end of February. The sodas are designed to boost gut health with 6 grams of prebiotic fiber and contain no added sugar, with 25-30% real fruit juice from concentrate. The prebiotic sodas contain plant-based fiber inulin, which dissolves in water and doesn't affect the taste. The functional beverage market has grown rapidly, with sales jumping 54% to $9.2 billion between March 2020 and March 2024, according to NielsenIQ. Simply Pop will be available at retailers in select regions and online nationwide via Amazon Fresh, with plans to expand to additional markets throughout the year, according to Coca-Cola.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 19, 2025 10:14 PM
Source:[FOX 26 Houston](https://www.fox26houston.com/news/what-is-prebiotic-soda-simply-pop)

**To Keep Up With Beverage Trends, Coca-Cola Is Launching a Prebiotic Soda**
The Coca-Cola Company is launching a new prebiotic soda called Simply Pop, which will be available in five flavors: citrus punch, lime, pineapple mango, fruit punch, and strawberry. According to the company, the sodas will contain prebiotic fiber, zinc, and vitamin C, and will be made with a fruit concentrate that does not include added sugar. Simply Pop will be sold in 12-ounce cans and will be available in West coast stores by the end of February 2025, with a nationwide offering through Amazon Fresh by the end of the year. The market for prebiotic beverages has grown from $197 million in 2020 to $440 million in 2024, with brands like Olipop and Poppi already well-established in the market. While Simply Pop claims to improve gut health, none of these claims have been officially proven by studies.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 19, 2025 06:34 PM
Source:[greenmatters.com](https://www.greenmatters.com/news/coca-cola-simply-pop-prebiotic-soda)

**Coca-Cola taps into prebiotic soda category**
The Coca-Cola Co. has launched Simply Pop, a prebiotic soda beverage line under its Simply brand. Simply Pop is a 'fruit-forward' line of beverages with 25% to 30% fruit juice from concentrate, 6 grams of prebiotic fiber, vitamin C, and zinc, and no added sugar. According to Becca Kerr, chief executive officer of nutrition at The Coca-Cola Co., consumers, particularly wellness-focused Gen Z-ers and millennials, were interested in juice and prebiotic sodas, and the company aimed to strike a balance between innovation and trust. Simply Pop will launch with five flavors in 12-oz slim cans and will be available at retailers in select regions and online nationwide through Amazon Fresh later this month, with plans to expand into additional markets nationwide throughout 2025.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 19, 2025 12:22 PM
Source:[foodbusinessnews.net](https://www.foodbusinessnews.net/articles/27723-coca-cola-taps-into-prebiotic-soda-category)

**Coca-Cola Is Taking A Stab At A Popular New Type Of Soda**
Coca-Cola is introducing a new prebiotic beverage called Simply Pop, featuring 6 grams of fiber, vitamin C, and zinc. The drink will be available in five flavors: Fruit Punch, Pineapple Mango, Citrus Punch, Strawberry, and Lime. Each 12-ounce can will retail for $2.49 and can be ordered on Amazon Fresh after its release. According to Coca-Cola, Simply Pop offers two benefits: juice-infused flavors and nutrients that support immune function and digestive health. As stated by Coca-Cola, 'This beverage offers two distinct benefits: it comes in five juice-infused flavors and features nutrients claimed to support optimal immune function and digestive health.'
Original language: en
Publish date: February 18, 2025 09:55 PM
Source:[mashed.com](https://www.mashed.com/1793178/coca-cola-new-soda/)

**Gutsy move: Coca-Cola launches prebiotic soda to compete with Olipop and Poppi**
Coca-Cola has launched a new prebiotic soda called Simply Pop, which contains 25-30% fruit juice, no added sugar, and 6 grams of prebiotic fiber to promote gut health. This move comes as the company competes with brands like Poppi and Olipop, which have been gaining popularity in the prebiotic soda market. While experts are split on the health benefits of prebiotic sodas, Coca-Cola claims that Simply Pop supports immune function and gut health. However, some critics have raised concerns about the health claims of prebiotic sodas, with a class-action complaint filed against Poppi in June 2024 accusing it of false advertising. Simply Pop will be available in select regions and online nationwide through Amazon Fresh, with plans to expand to more markets in the coming months.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 18, 2025 09:01 PM
Source:[TODAY.com](https://www.today.com/food/trends/coca-cola-simply-pop-prebiotic-soda-olipop-poppi-rcna192666)

**Coke Is Officially Coming After Olipop With This New Line Of Sodas**
The Coca-Cola Company is entering the prebiotic soda market with its new line, Simply Pop. The line features five flavors: Strawberry, Pineapple Mango, Fruit Punch, Lime, and Citrus Punch, made with 20-30% real fruit juice and no added sugars. Each can contains 6 grams of prebiotic fiber to promote gut health and boost the digestive process. Simply Pop will debut in select retail markets and online via Amazon Fresh in late February 2025 for $2.49 per 12-ounce can.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 18, 2025 05:14 PM
Source:[thedailymeal.com](https://www.thedailymeal.com/1792614/coke-new-simply-pop-olipop/)

**Coca-Cola announces prebiotic soda brand Simply Pop**
Coca-Cola has announced the launch of Simply Pop, a prebiotic soda brand that includes 6 grams of prebiotic fiber to support gut health and Vitamin C and Zinc to support immune function. The brand offers five flavors, including Strawberry, Pineapple Mango, Fruit Punch, Lime, and Citrus Punch, with no added sugar and 25-30% real fruit juice from concentrate. Simply Pop will be available in select regions and online nationwide via Amazon Fresh later this month, with plans to expand to additional markets nationwide throughout 2025.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 18, 2025 04:10 PM
Source:[Markets Insider](https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/coca-cola-announces-prebiotic-soda-brand-simply-pop-1034375076)

**How Coca-Cola is joining the gut-health soda wars**
Coca-Cola Co. has launched a new prebiotic soda brand called Simply Pop, which will compete with better-for-you brands like Olipop and Poppi. Simply Pop will be available in five flavors and will contain 6 grams of prebiotic fiber, 25-30% real fruit juice, and 60 calories per can. The brand will roll out to Target, Albertsons, and Publix stores and on Amazon Fresh later this month, with plans to expand throughout the U.S. in 2025. According to Becca Kerr, CEO of Nutrition for Coca-Cola, the brand aims to strike a balance between innovation and trust to attract new drinkers to the category. Terika Fasakin, North America brand senior director for Simply, noted that Gen Z has a strong emotional connection to the Simply brand, which has been a trusted name in the juice market for over 20 years.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 18, 2025 03:12 PM
Source:[adage.com](https://adage.com/article/marketing-news-strategy/coca-colas-simply-pop-prebiotic-competitor-poppi-olipop/2602721)

**Amazon Sale: Red Bull Variety Pack at a Discounted Price**
Amazon is offering a special deal on Red Bull energy drinks. The 'Red Bull Energy Drink Variety Pack' is a 12-pack set containing 3 types of 250ml cans: Red Bull Energy Drink, Red Bull Purple Edition, and Red Bull Sugarfree. The sale period is until February 28th at 23:59. It is recommended to check if the product is still on sale before making a purchase.
Original language: ja
Publish date: February 14, 2025 03:18 PM
Source:[GAME Watch](https://game.watch.impress.co.jp/docs/news/1662949.html)

**12 Packs Of Sprite, Dr Pepper, Coke Zero, And More Soda For Just $3.37-$4.45 Shipped From Amazon!**
Amazon is offering 12 packs of Sprite, Dr Pepper, Coke Zero, and more soda for $3.37-$4.45 shipped, a price drop from $7.49 yesterday. This is the lowest price ever from Amazon. Prime members can take advantage of free shipping with a $35+ order or get free next-day shipping with a free trial of Amazon Prime. Additionally, students and EBT/Medicaid cardholders can save on Prime membership.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 09, 2025 01:24 AM
Source:[DansDeals.com](https://www.dansdeals.com/shopping-deals/amazon/12-pack-of-dr-pepper-or-dr-pepper-zero-for-3-37-4-12-shipped-from-amazon/)

**Coca-Cola's Newest Flavor Takes Us Back To Last Summer**
Coca-Cola is releasing a new flavor, Coca-Cola Orange Cream, which features the traditional cola taste infused with refreshing orange and smooth, creamy vanilla flavors. The company states that the new beverage was created to satisfy customer demand for the classic, nostalgic orange cream taste. The flavor will debut in major retailers across the U.S. and Canada on February 10, 2025, and will be available in various sizes, including 12-packs of 12-ounce cans, 10-packs of miniature cans, and 20-ounce glass bottles. A Zero Sugar version will also be available. According to a PR notice, 'it's a tasty, modern twist on iconic Coca-Cola and nostalgic Orange Cream in a new and delicious form.'
Original language: en
Publish date: January 27, 2025 05:55 PM
Source:[foodrepublic.com](https://www.foodrepublic.com/1772280/coca-cola-new-flavor-orange-cream/)

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, once a retailer like Amazon lists a product as SNAP EBT eligible, it tends to remain so unless there are specific policy changes or shifts in eligibility rules. SNAP EBT eligibility is typically determined by certain regulations and agreements between the government and retailers, pertaining to the nature of the products. Since Coca-Cola is a commonly accepted item under SNAP benefits, the probability of it being delisted as SNAP EBT eligible without a significant regulatory change or company policy shift is generally low.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Regulatory Stability
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), which oversees SNAP, has not recently implemented abrupt or significant changes to the types of food products eligible under SNAP. This factor supports the continuation of current eligibility for Coca-Cola.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Amazon's Consistent Policy
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Amazon has a track record of offering a wide range of SNAP-eligible products and has been actively expanding the availability of SNAP EBT for online purchases. This indicates a low likelihood of arbitrary changes for a staple product like Coca-Cola.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Consumer Demand for Convenience
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: There is strong consumer demand for convenience in accessing SNAP-eligible products online, which Amazon is likely to continue catering to by maintaining Coca-Cola's eligibility status.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The articles largely focus on Coca-Cola's introduction of new packaging sizes in Germany and their launch of prebiotic soda, Simply Pop. These developments indicate Coca-Cola's ongoing efforts to innovate and diversify its product range, suggesting a stable relationship with retailers like Amazon for listing regular Coca-Cola products as SNAP EBT eligible.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: The news of planned economic boycotts against Amazon and Coca-Cola could theoretically influence Amazon's decisions regarding the products it highlights or lists with certain eligibility tags, like SNAP EBT. However, there is no direct indication that these boycotts would specifically affect the SNAP EBT eligibility listing for Coca-Cola on Amazon.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To establish an initial probability, I will consider the historical consistency of SNAP eligibility listings on Amazon. Generally, such listings remain consistent unless there is a regulatory change or a policy update from either Amazon or the government program. Based on historical observation, it's rare for items that are listed as eligible to become ineligible without significant external changes. Therefore, I will set an initial probability of 75% that the item will remain 'SNAP EBT eligible' on April 1, 2025.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Stable Regulatory Environment
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: There have been no significant changes in government policy regarding SNAP eligibility for soda products. This stability suggests that there is a high likelihood of the status quo being maintained.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Amazon's Efforts to Support EBT
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Amazon has been expanding its efforts to support SNAP recipients, and it aligns with their broader corporate strategy to be accessible to all consumers, including those using EBT.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Potential Amazon Policy Changes
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: While Amazon rarely changes SNAP eligibility once listed, internal business strategy changes related to logistics or profitability might prompt a shift, although there's no current indication of this happening.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Consumer Demand and Market Trends
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Coca-Cola remains a high-demand product, especially among SNAP users, maintaining consumer pressure to keep it EBT eligible. This supports the likelihood of continued eligibility.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: There is no direct news indicating changes to SNAP eligibility for Coca-Cola products or related regulatory shifts affecting Amazon's listings.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: There is a planned boycott of Amazon and Coca-Cola by activist groups, which may influence Amazon's listing strategies or pressure from public perception.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To determine the likelihood that Amazon will list a 12-pack of Coca-Cola as 'SNAP EBT eligible' on April 1, 2025, we begin by examining the historical stability of SNAP EBT eligibility for similar consumer products. Historically, classifications for SNAP EBT eligibility for staple non-perishable beverages like soda have been consistent due to the limited criteria required for such classification by the USDA. Assuming no major policy adjustments, we estimate the baseline probability that the listing remains unchanged at approximately 80%, based on the historical continuity observed with similar products listed over similar periods.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Regulatory stability of SNAP guidelines
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The regulatory framework governing SNAP benefits is relatively stable, with guidelines generally not subject to frequent change. Given the nature of Coca-Cola as a non-perishable processed beverage, it consistently meets the eligibility criteria unless broader legislative changes are enacted. Therefore, this factor supports maintaining SNAP EBT eligibility.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Amazon's listing behavior
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Amazon's past behavior in maintaining or updating product eligibility labels for SNAP EBT does not demonstrate significant variance. The likelihood they update or removes eligibility without significant USDA or vendor prompting is low, increasing confidence in the status quo being preserved.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Changes in consumer buying policy or eligibility definitions
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: There are no known large-scale initiatives or changes scheduled for implementation that would redefine eligibility prior to the resolution date. While changes are possible, they are typically procedural or regulatory, which remain unlikely in such a short time frame.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market factors or external pressures
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: External commercial pressures such as supply chain issues or major changes in vendor relations with Amazon are unlikely to specifically target or affect such a widely recognized and stable product line, such as Coca-Cola.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: No significant changes in regulatory or Amazon's product offering policies regarding SNAP EBT are reported within the news articles, supporting continuity in the listing status. Coca-Cola's new product introductions mainly focus on format and size variations in Germany, which do not directly affect SNAP eligibility requirements.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: The news of planned economic boycotts targeting both Amazon and Coca-Cola by groups like The People's Union could potentially influence changes in marketing or product listing strategies in the short term. However, there is no direct link indicating listings for SNAP EBT eligible items will be impacted.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To determine the likelihood of Amazon still listing a 12-pack of Coca-Cola as 'SNAP EBT eligible' on April 1, 2025, we can start by considering the base rate of changes in Amazon's listing policies regarding SNAP EBT eligibility for common consumer goods like Coca-Cola. Historically, there have been minimal changes to the eligibility of large brand-name sodas for SNAP EBT within short time spans, particularly when they are already listed as eligible. Changes typically result from regulatory shifts or direct policy changes rather than internal listing updates. Given that no major regulatory changes for SNAP EBT have been reported recently that would affect soft drink eligibility, the initial probability of there being no change by April 1, 2025, is high.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Regulatory Stability
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: No significant regulatory changes impacting SNAP EBT eligibility for sugary beverages like Coca-Cola have been reported in 2025.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Amazon's Listing Practices
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Amazon tends to maintain consistent labeling for EBT eligibility unless prompted by external regulatory changes or internal dumping of non-selling or inefficient items.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Consumer Demand for Coca-Cola
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Coca-Cola's continued popularity and status as a high-demand product make it likely that Amazon would maintain its EBT eligibility to maximize purchase options available to consumers.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Potential for Policy Advocacy Against Sugary Drinks
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: There is an ongoing advocacy movement against the inclusion of sugary beverages in SNAP due to health concerns, which could potentially cause future policy changes, but given the short time frame, any such changes would be premature for this forecast.
